imports Main


begin

typedecl entity
typedecl event

consts
  Man :: "entity ⇒ bool"
  Sidewalk :: "entity ⇒ bool"
  Dirty :: "entity ⇒ bool"
  On :: "event ⇒ bool"
  Agent :: "event ⇒ entity ⇒ bool"
  Patient :: "event ⇒ entity ⇒ bool"
  Outdoors :: "entity ⇒ bool"
  Found :: "event ⇒ bool"
  In :: "entity ⇒ entity ⇒ bool"
  Outside :: "event ⇒ bool"
  OldMan :: "entity ⇒ bool"
  HardwareParts :: "entity ⇒ bool"
  Sells :: "event ⇒ bool"

(* Explanation 1: The man is on a dirty sidewalk. *)
axiomatization where
  explanation_1: "∃x y e. Man x ∧ Sidewalk y ∧ Dirty y ∧ On e ∧ Agent e x ∧ Patient e y"

(* Explanation 2: Sidewalks are found outdoors, therefore, the man is outside. *)
axiomatization where
  explanation_2: "∀x y e. Sidewalk x ∧ Outdoors y ⟶ Found e ∧ Patient e x ∧ In x y"

(* Explanation 3: The man is outside. *)
axiomatization where
  explanation_3: "∃x e. Man x ∧ Outside e ∧ Agent e x"


theorem hypothesis:
  (* Premise: An old man sells hardware parts on a dirty sidewalk. *)
  assumes asm: "OldMan x ∧ HardwareParts y ∧ Sidewalk z ∧ Dirty z ∧ Sells e ∧ Agent e x ∧ Patient e y ∧ On e"
  (* Hypothesis: The man is outside. *)
  shows "∃x e. Man x ∧ Outside e ∧ Agent e x"
proof -
  (* From the premise, we can get known information about the old man, hardware parts, sidewalk, dirty sidewalk, sells, agent, patient, and being on the sidewalk. *)
  from asm have "OldMan x ∧ HardwareParts y ∧ Sidewalk z ∧ Dirty z ∧ Sells e ∧ Agent e x ∧ Patient e y ∧ On e" <ATP>
  (* There is a logical relation Implies(A, B), Implies(the man is on a dirty sidewalk, sidewalks are found outdoors) *)
  (* A is from explanatory sentence 1, B is from explanatory sentence 2. *)
  (* We already have the man on a dirty sidewalk, so we can infer that sidewalks are found outdoors. *)
  then have "Sidewalk z ∧ Outdoors y" <ATP>
  (* There is a logical relation Implies(B, C), Implies(sidewalks are found outdoors, the man is outside) *)
  (* B is from the previous step, C is from explanatory sentence 3. *)
  (* We have found that the sidewalk is outdoors, so we can infer that the man is outside. *)
  then have "Man x ∧ Outside e ∧ Agent e x" <ATP>
  then show ?thesis <ATP>
qed

end
', 'logical information': 'Logical Propositions:

B: sidewalks are found outdoors (from Explanatory Sentence 2)
C: the man is outside (from Explanatory Sentence 2)
